docs.snippet: "The Education of Patrick Silver" concludes Jerome Charyn's trilogy of novels ("Blue Eyes" and "Marilyn the Wild" are the first two) about New York cops and marginal crooks and killers who suggest an animated cartoon by a Chagall of the Ashcan...
docs.lead_paragraph: "The Education of Patrick Silver" concludes Jerome Charyn's trilogy of novels ("Blue Eyes" and "Marilyn the Wild" are the first two) about New York cops and marginal crooks and killers who suggest an animated cartoon by a Chagall of the Ashcan School. The novels stress, among other things, a fluidity of affiliations between its cops and crooks: Patrick Silver, an ex-policeman too addicted to Guinness stout to remain useful to the force, has switched sides.
docs.abstract: Jerome Charyn book The Education of Patrick Silver revd by Richard P Brickner

headline.main: The Education Of Patrick Silver; Patrick Silver

docs.snippet: ITAIPU, Brazil In one sweep, the huge power shovel scooped up 15 cubic yards of rich red mud and gray basalt rock and deposited them on top of a 75-ton truck with wheels as tall as a full-grown man.

docs.abstract: Itaipu Dam on Parana River is seen as Brazil's most important effort to extend its influence in Basin of the Rio de la Plata; $6-billion dam will generate 6 times as much elec as Aswan Dam when it begins operation in 80's; Gen Costa Cavalcanti says problems arising from project have all been resolved by common consent Brazil and Paraguay; map; illus (M)

headline.main: Itaipu Dam: Brazil's Giant Step; ITAIPU PROJECT: BRAZIL'S BIG STEP

docs.snippet: A 22-year-old man who had reluctantly come to New York City to help a friend move out of a fraternity house was stabbed to death at an entrance to Columbia University's Butler Library Saturday night. Dozens of other students were moving their...
docs.lead_paragraph: A 22-year-old man who had reluctantly come to New York City to help a friend move out of a fraternity house was stabbed to death at an entrance to Columbia University's Butler Library Saturday night. Dozens of other students were moving their belongings into and out of dormitories on the block when the murder took place.

headline.main: Man Helping a Friend Is Slain By Thief Near Columbia Library; Man Helping a Friend Is Slain By Thief Near Columbia Library

docs.snippet: Werner Lieb, a horticulturist who had owned Lieb's greenhouses in New Rochelle, N.Y., from 1922 until his retirement in 1957, died Tuesday in a nursing, home in South Yarmouth, Mass. He was 93 years old and lived in Truro on Cape Cod.

docs.snippet: RIO DE JANEIRO Two years after soaring petroleum prices and the world recession brought Brazil's "economic miracle" to an end, the country is moving toward a new model of development. Despite denials by Government leaders that a shift is under way,...
docs.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO Two years after soaring petroleum prices and the world recession brought Brazil's "economic miracle" to an end, the country is moving toward a new model of development. Despite denials by Government leaders that a shift is under way, the emerging pattern appears to include:
docs.abstract: Article on Brazilian moves toward new model of development 2 yrs after soaring oil prices and world recession brought 'econ miracle' to end; cites greater role for state in econ, new emphasis on Brazilian-made goods to replace imports and slower rate of econ growth during next few yrs as emerging pattern; says Pres Ernesto Geisel views approaching munic elections in Nov as test of his prestige and policies; says Geisel appears intent on carrying out modest pol liberalization; describes mil Govt's hold on power as indication that there is little likelihood that econ crisis and pol tensions will lead to unrest; illus (L)

docs.snippet: Marilyn Elizebeth Miller and John Sloane Griswold Jr. were married yesterday afternoon in Greenwich, Conn., at the home of the bridegroom's uncle, George Lauder Greenway. The Rev. Raymond D. Scott, a Presbyterian minister, performed the ceremony.

docs.snippet: Federal bank examiners have been intensively scrutinizing the records of the American Bank  Trust Company, a New York bank with five offices, because of fears among authorities for the bank's financial stability, according to sources familiar with...
docs.lead_paragraph: Federal bank examiners have been intensively scrutinizing the records of the American Bank Trust Company, a New York bank with five offices, because of fears among authorities for the bank's financial stability, according to sources familiar with the inquiry.
docs.abstract: Fed bank examiners study Amer Bank & Trust Co records, reptdly because of fears among authorities about bank's financial stability; 1/3 of bank's $152-million in loans outstanding are reptdly substandard, doubtful or lost; reduction in deposits from $229-million Dec 31 '75, to $199-million in June 30 '76, reptdly would have been more severe if not for increase in time deposits gained by paying interest rate on overnight loans of 1-1.5% above competitive levels; Fed authorities believe as much as $40-million in loans would be required to keep bank afloat; bank has already been borrowing $6.8-million daily from other banks via Fed funds; ctfs of deposit coming due may key detriment of bank's future (M)

headline.main: FEDERAL EXAMINERS SCRUTINIZE RECORDS OF A NEW YORK BANK; ITS STABILITY IN QUESTION Third of American Bank & Trust's $152 Million in Loans Rated in Substandard Class FEDERAL EXAMINERS STUDY BANK'S DATA
